From:	trogers@math.fsu.edu
Sent:	Saturday, December 30, 2006 4:35 PM
To:	Governor Jeb Bush
Subject:	Re: need help with damaging records

Dear Warren:

The reason I wrote the Governor is because I need a legislator, not a  
litigator.

I am going to sue the State of Florida?  No.

I am currently trying to settle a case against a public entity that  
for now will remain unnamed in hopes you listening.

The entity erroneously stigmatizing Military Discharge documents ,  
albeit it at all times Honorable, to deny me employment.  They wish  
to settle.

Their insurance company's lawyer says they NOT mark the records as  
Confidential and separate them from the rest of the applicant records  
unless we show him statutory authority.  My sister was an attorney in  
the Florida Dept. of Labor in Tallahassee and has sated that they do  
this there AND many persons my attorneys have contacted have found  
that lots of people practice that concept, yet, there is no statutory  
authority for it.

The Sunshine Laws need to be "tweaked" so that documents that have  
been declared null and void and erroneously stigmatizing are EXEMPT  
from this law.

As a Disabled American Veteran the VA paid for me to to FSU.  I got a  
teaching degree.  I refused to relinquish the discharge papers in  
Leon County when I applied to teach.  I understand their position, it  
was my prerogative, I lost out.  Since then I moved to another  
Florida County and decided that since there is no National teach  
check and a teacher must apply in every single county each time they  
seek employment across the entire country and since I was still  
chipping away at the Army to correct this injustice as per the  
original U.S. Court of Claims order, my life must go on and so I had  
to turn over the documents.

I had a corrective document, and DD215.  However, that is not a  
standalone document so I had to also hand over the document that it  
corrects, DD214.

The DD214 could say anything, but it is WRONG, never happened!  It  
could say molested kids or killed 14 people!  Whatever you want, take  
your pick.  IT's WRONG and therefore erroneously stigmatizes me.  As  
soon I told the Army Review Boards Agency (a very powerful agency)  
they immediately a issued a NEW and completely "clean" (their word)  
DD214, along with a letter stating all previously issued Discharge  
documents should be destroyed.

I was still talking to the potential employer, who went so far as to  
ask me for court documents!  I sent them the new DD214 and the letter.

It was too late.  They had seen the erroneous information and thus I  
was prejudiced.  Now I have use under the ADA for a "perceived  
disability."  The EEOC helped nothing despite their own rules.


When asked, before any EEOC or court complaint, why they did not hire  
me, they cited those documents!  Had they NOT done that they would  
have "gotten away with it."

I do not not need litigation.  I repeat, please.. look at this way...  
on you r last day of office commit a good, decent, random act of  
kindness... pull a few strings... call it "Ted's law", but get the  
Sunshine Law tweaked so that exempts court ruled erroneous, false,  
documents that in the wrong hands --anyone can get them-- can ruined  
a persons life!

HELP!

Ted Rogers



On Dec 27, 2006, at 3:03 PM, Governor Jeb Bush wrote:

> Dear Mr. Rogers:
>
> Governor Bush received your e-mail and asked me to respond.
>
> Thank you for your suggestion regarding changes in the law.  I know  
> the Governor understands your concern and appreciates your suggestion.
>
> The Florida Constitution limits the Governor's intervention in  
> matters that should be resolved through the court system.  You may  
> also wish to contact an attorney to answer your legal questions and  
> advise you in this regard.  If you need assistance in locating an  
> attorney, please call the Florida Bar's Referral Service at  
> 1-800-342-8011.  For those unable to afford a lawyer, Florida Legal  
> services or your local legal aid office has information about the  
> availability of pro bono counsel.  The main telephone number for  
> Florida Legal Services is 850-385-7900.
>
> As you may know, Florida has very few laws governing employer/ 
> employee relations.  The Florida Legislature is responsible for  
> debating and creating new laws, so you may want to contact your  
> legislators to make them aware of your views.  The Governor's staff  
> will share your concerns with Governor-elect Charlie Crist.
>
> Thank you again for writing.
>
> Warren Davis
> Aide to the Governor
> Office of Citizens' Services

> -----Original Message-----
> From: trogers@math.fsu.edu [mailto:trogers@math.fsu.edu]
> Sent: Tuesday, December 26, 2006 9:57 PM
> To: Governor Jeb Bush
> Subject: need help with damaging records
>
>
> Dear Governor Bush:
>
> My name is Ted L. Rogers and I need your help.  I pray for it.  here
> is my problem in two parts,  1. Background, and 2. Problem:
>
> 1. Background:
>
> My military discharge certificate (DD214), at all times characterized
> as Honorable, has been reissued twice since Dec. 1982.  I never had
> lawyer as they would not help me, for whatever reason, all those
> years that I persisted to correct my records, etc.
>
> My most recent Discharge Certificate (DD214), issued in 2006 by order
> the Army Review Boards Agency finally clears away all previous
> stigmatizing factors and then some.
>
> This took no less than two Federal Cases, plus some other actions.
> My mother typed my letters for year after year, until in Dec. 1991 I
> won what turned out to be round one.  I have prevailed consistently
> ever since.  My DD214 (my discharge itself) was ruled by the US Court
> of Claims (1991) to be illegal, wrongful, and stigmatizing, and
> without Due Process -- I was ordered reinstated in Dec. 1991.
>
> I am also a disabled veteran and the VA, under its Chapter 31
> Vocational Rehabilitation Program, paid for my 4 years of college at
> FSU, plus a living stipend, where I excelled -- 5 Honor Societies,
> Cum Laude, B.S. degree received in Dec. 1999.
>
> After my second Federal Court complaint, in 1996, the Army issued
> what is known as a DD215 Correction Form to DD214.  In other words,
> even after winning in 1991 I still had the same Discharge document
> that stigmatized me terribly.
>
> For example, all Honorably Discharged Service persons can get
> unemployment insurance to help them readjust to civilian life, but I
> was denied, they said, because I was released "for cause."  Even
> after I cleared that up I was still denied.  A State congressman said
> he would try to change the laws involved so people coming after would
> be turned down on a retroactive application for said insurance.   I
> still have his 3 letters to me.
>
> However, for anyone to have or to review my DD214, as most all public
> and private employers do, I need to give them not only my DD214 but
> also my DD215 as it indicates what  Correctly should be in certain
> numbered blocks of the DD214.  You see, they never gave me then a new
> and clean DD214.  They have now just this year when I wrote to them
> that I had been denied a job.  (You cannot sue the military for
> damages due to the FERES Doctrine).
>
> The Dept. of the Army also sent me a cover letter with that new
> Discharge (DD214) stating: "We advise that all previously issued
> discharged documents be destroyed."
>
>
> 2. Problem:
>
> Here is my current problem, is not with any of the foregoing it is
> with Florida law:
>
> I was denied employment by a public entity in the State of Florida.
> At the time, 2004, I gave them, as required for background check, my
> DD214 and the corrective DD215.
>
> I believe that a reasonable person could easily read the two together
> and see that: a) I had an Honorable discharge (the DD214 itself
> reflects that);   and, b) the stigmatizing information erroneously
> placed on the DD214 was completely corrected/removed by the DD215.
> These documents not should have hurt me, but they did as stated in a
> letter from the public entity that refused to pass me through their
> background check for employment.  Employment  the VA trained me for
> under its Chapter 31 program for 4 years at FSU.
>
> I later gave the employing entity the brand new DD214 with said Army
> cover letter, they never responded further, they were finished with  
> me.
>
> Now, I am told that Florida Sunshine Laws will not let them destroy
> those documents, the previously issued ones as the Army letter  
> advises.
>
> I do not believe that is fair or right.  If that is correct, then I
> believe the Sunshine Law must be changed to allow destruction of
> documents such as mine that have been deemed in finality by a US
> Federal Court and by the Army Review Boards Agency to be: legal
> error, erroneous, and stigmatizing,  and may clearly continue to
> stigmatize and damage persons such as myself.  Apparently, I have
> already lost out of my desired employment.  It is not too late to
> destroy the documents, nor is it ever to late for prevention of this
> in the future.  (It may not be too late for me, though they will
> never hire me, they said.)
>
> I hope you will understand and can write a letter in my support and
> help me to modify this law.
>
> I will happy to visit with you or your representative and show you
> all necessary and complete documentation or everything I have out
> forward in this email.  For, those facts are not in contention.
>
> Please advise.
>
> Very Sincerely,
>
> Ted L. Rogers
> 26 DEC 2006
>

Subject:	Thank you for your response

Dear Mr. Davis,
 
I want to thank you on behalf of the family for your response to my email.  However, that is what the family has encountered throughout this ordeal, no one is willing to listen to them, therefore every effort they have put forth to getting the truth out about their brother has not come to fruition.  They have a letter prepared with a few attached documents that they have sent to Gov. Bush with the hopes that he will at least look at them.  There are letters from the "alleged victim" and her sister and their mother, all stating that he did not touch her and she was told to say those things by her aunt and HRS or she would never see her mother again.  
 
Lacy Mahon was the attorney of record and when he was confronted about his misrepresentation of their brother and how things were so botched, Mr. Mahon committed suicide, the whole case is strung with things like that and someone really needs to get to the bottom of it. 
 
Sadly, this case reads like a John Grisham novel of small town injustice.
 
I am afraid that their only  hope of getting to the bottom of what really happened to their brother is to involve an investigative reporter (however that may compound what is already going on, who knows anymore).  
 
Thank you and the Governor and Lt. Governor for responding.  I will pass on  your email to them.  I really do appreciate the time you took to read the email and respond, that means a lot and it will mean a lot to this family.
 
Regards to you all and have a wonderful healthy and happy New Year!!!
 
Denese 
 Phone: 912-427-9800 
 email: designsbydenese@bellsouth.net
 
 
 
 
-------Original Message-------
 
From: Governor Jeb Bush
Date: 12/27/2006 3:13:01 PM
To: designsbydenese
Subject: RE: Copy of our email to Mrs. Jennings - FYI
 
Dear Denese:
 
Thank you for writing to Lieutenant Governor Toni Jennings.  The Lieutenant Governor understands the pain a prisoner's family and friends endure and asked me to respond on her behalf.
 
Questions about the guilt or innocence of prisoners, mental capacity to commit a crime, or the procedural fairness of their convictions must be addressed in the courts. Those who wish to contest judicial rulings should speak with an attorney about what appellate procedures may be available. If you need assistance in locating an attorney, contact the Florida Bar's Attorney Referral Service at 1-800-342-8011.
 
Decisions over prisoners' movement within the system, rehabilitative or educational programs, temporary release permission, and incentive gain time are under the authority of the Department of Corrections.  For further assistance, please write to Department of Corrections, 2601 Blair Stone Road, Tallahassee, Florida 32399-2500.
 
The Florida Parole Commission, an entity independent of the Governor's control, determines the issues of control release and early release.  The Commission's address is Building C, 2601 Blair Stone Road, Tallahassee, Florida  32399-2450.
 
Thank you again for writing.  The Lieutenant Governor and Governor Bush hope this information is helpful.
 
                                                                        Sincerely,
 
 
 
                                                                        Warren Davis
                                                                        Office of Citizens' Services

Dear Mrs. Jennings:
 
I am writing to ask where we should send a letter in hopes that Mr. Bush would review the same.  We also have back up information to substantiate the families case.
 
This family has a member of their family who is serving time in Starke Florida for a crime he did not commit.  I am not one to usually get on the band wagon for such a cause, but after reading all of the back up information I told them I would try to help.  This man has been in Starke for 21 years for allegedly abusing his step daughter, however there are letters from the wife and other daughter who say that Mr. Hickox did not commit this crime and that the step daughter was told by another family  member to say these things, she would not recant her story for fear of being locked up herself, but all of their letters seem to fall on deaf ears.  This is a poor family and Mr. Hickox has never been written up for any thing since  his incarceration.  It seems that no attorney wants to get involved in even looking over these documents and he and his family are distraught.  He is supposed to be up for parole after serving 25 years but they say he isn't even listed with the parole board.
 
Could you please point us in the right direction to some legal counsel that you think would at least hear this family out, meet with them and give them some assistance.  I feel this would be a feather in someone's cap if they could get this innocent man pardoned after spending 21 years in prison for a crime he did not commit.   It appears to have been a kangaroo court that convicted this man, you should read these documents they boggle the mind.

From:	Minji0107@aol.com
Sent:	Tuesday, December 26, 2006 6:46 PM
To:	Governor Jeb Bush
Subject:	Re: Rosa C. Figarola & Deborah White-Labora

In a message dated 12/26/2006 2:51:34 P.M. Eastern Standard Time, Jeb.Bush@MyFlorida.com writes:

Dear Ms. Min Ji:

Thank you for your recent e-mail to Governor Bush requesting assistance with a child custody matter.  He has asked me to respond.

The Florida Constitution limits the Governor's intervention in matters that should be resolved through the court system.  If you are unhappy with a ruling or feel a case has not been handled according to the law, you should speak with an attorney about what appellate procedures may be available.  For those unable to afford a lawyer, Florida Legal Services or the county legal aid association has information about the availability of pro bono counsel.  The main telephone number of Florida Legal Services is (850) 385-7900.  Those dissatisfied with their representatives should consider choosing another attorney.

Thank you again for writing.  The Governor is sorry to learn of the problems you are facing and wishes he could be of more assistance.  Please know this is due to lack of jurisdiction, not lack of concern.

Sincerely,



Warren Davis
Office of Citizens' Services

Subject:  Rosa C. Figarola & Deborah White-Labora

Dear Mister Jeb Bush and Mister Charlie Crist:

These two people, Rosa C. Figarola & Deborah White-Labora, are two "judges" in Miami-Dade County.  They have committed a government crime against me.

Last year, I was hired as an accounting clerk in a "law firm" named "Spiegel & Utrera, P.A." located at Miami, Florida.  I was hired by the controller of this business.  This controller was a very old gay man.  But from the very beginning of my employment, I was sexually harassed by this old gay man controller who aimed at a sexual affair in the office.  I did not abide by such evil supervisory power and never responded to the sexual affair suggestion in any way.  

The old gay man felt powerless and looked for ways to charge me and to fire me.  At last, this controller charged me of breaking the employment law on Racial Discrimination because I asked some Hispanic/Black employees to turn off Black Neighborhood Music when we were all at work.  I was fired through this course.

After I got fired, I only contacted the owner of Spiegel & Utrera, P.A. for the wrongful discharge.  But Spiegel kept his controller and refused to talk to me.  After an altogether six-month of respectful contact, I noticed Spiegel that I would go to his office to talk about my employment case.  Spiegel still did not respond me.  When I got to his office, I discovered that he had called police charging me of trespassing.  In addition to that, he released his old gay man controller to American Family Court trying to file an injunction against me charging me Sexual, Dating, Repeat & Domestic Violence.

Rosa C. Figarola & Deborah White-Laborah

Rosa C. Figarola gave the old gay man controller a denying petition, but instead of marking that the accusations did not meet the criteria of an American Family Court injunction.  She marked something else alleging that the old gay man controller's accusations did meet the criteria of American Family Court values and hence she subpoenaed me to American Family Court to meet the old gay man controller.

When I received Rosa C. Figarola's American Family Court paper, I felt I was sexually assaulted.  I felt so ill, sick and disgusting that I wanted to request two policemen accompanying me to American Family Court to see Rosa C. Figarola and the old gay man controller.

Under the threat from Rosa C. Figarola's American Family Court paper that I would be arrested if I would not go to her American Family Court, I surrendered and went into American Family Court to see Rosa C. Figarola and the old gay man controller.  Waiting for me was Deborah White-Laborah and the old gay man controller.

Inside her American Family Court, Deborah White-Laborah called me bad names such as "crazy", "mentally ills" and "need to take pills" and said to me that I would be given a permanent American Family Court injunction if I would continue contact Spiegel & Utrera for my employment case, which meaned I would be denied all employment opportunities.  She then gave me an extension of the original denying order telling me NOT to contact Spiegel & Utrera for my employment case.  Even the old gay man controller could NOT believe that Deborah White-Laborah spoke out like that.  

I sent lots of email to various government officials asking for a sound judgement upon this case.  I said that I had all along gone after the owner of the business, NOT the old gay man, for justice in my employment case.  I could NEVER let this case go because not only the old gay man controller sexually harassed me and retaliated by various power abuses.  The most offensive part in this case is charging me of breaking the employment law on Racial Discrimination for asking Hispanic/Black employees turn off Black Neighborhood Music while we all at work.  In the recent decades, America has already been in the dark tyranny of Black Power.  In addition, please remember that the office was located in a very fine neighborhood and that the business held itself to the public as a professional office.

Therefore, I continue went after the owner of the business for justice by contacting him and  various regulating offices, one of which was his old gay man controller's professional license.  Because I did NOT believe the old gay man controller met the ethic standard of a professional accountant.  

Spiegel & Utrera used that information from me and went to American Police charging me of breaking American Family Court Values of Sexual, Dating, Repeating and Domestic Violence.  American Police listened to Spiegel & Utrera, arrested me and put me into American Jail.  My employment, my financial security and my housing security hence fell into jeopardy.  

Right before American Police arrested me (instead of arresting Spiegel & Utrera), I saw in my vision that the old gay man controller and Deborah White-Laborah were perpetrating something against me and they were like close personal friends or even relatives.  I saw that I vomited blood.  While I was "screwed" into American Jail, I was again sent to see Deborah White-Laborah.  And when she named the old gay man controller to me, she purposefully sounded abnormally personal trying to confirm something with me.

A supposed Court of Justice, under Rosa C. Figarola & Deborah White-Laborah's leadership, became a place of dark crime.  The government has committed a crime upon me because some members of the government wanted to see me "mess" with illegitimate males such as black man or gay man.  They perpetrated this dark crime against me.  When I was just hired, member of the underground government, Paul Harvey, announced on radio that I would go through a "911" (messing with an old gay man).  I did NOT accept the old gay man to any personal level and so they had the old gay man fire me and make bad charge against me in American Family Court just to sexually violate me in a spiritual way.

As of today, 25 December 2006, American Criminal Court, in the hand of the criminal underground government, still charge me of violating a denying restraining order and stalking the old gay man controller.  Because I went after owner of the business for his sheltering his controller's sexual harassment, retaliation, abuse of supervisory power, taking advantage of the tyrannic Black Power, abuse of the Employment Law on Racial Discrimination, making bad call to police, and filing bad papers in American Courts.

What Rosa C. Figarola and Deborah White-Laborah did to me is a dark, heinous crime unbelievable to average people.  And they perpetrated this dark crime within a place supposedly for Truth and Justice.  Allowing Rosa C. Figarola and Deborah White-Laborah to continue stay at Judgeship can only darken the color of America and discredit the name of court.

The government needs to review this case and restore Justice for America, American Court and American Judgeship.  Rosa C. Figarola and Deborah White-Labora must be removed.

Very Truly Yours, 
  Nancy Min Ji
25 December 2006

Dear Warren Davis:  Please know that I am a victim of these two female's criminal conducts.  I do NOT need to appeal their court behaviors to convince I am innocent.  These two females have intentionally abused judgeship in hand, disregarded basic common sense and basic human values, and committed criminal activities against me.  I do not think they can continue stay at judgeship.  If the governor can appoint a judge, why cannot the governor remove a judge?  The governor know well that I am not talking about appeal a normal court ruling, but the character and behavioral aspects of these two "judges".  They raped me spiritually and disrupted my life in a horrible way --- family wise, friends wise, job wise, income wise, housing wise.  They have committed criminal activities against me, against court justice and against human well-being.  I am being very tender when only asking for "removal" because these two females deserved to be prosecuted.  It will be irresponsible for the governor not to remove these two people from judgeship.  ---  Nancy Min Ji

> ----- Original Message ----- 
> From: "Governor Jeb Bush" <Jeb.Bush@MyFlorida.com>
> To: "Bulraj Bassral" <bassral@ntlworld.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, December 05, 2006 2:22 PM
> Subject: RE: Legal Campaign against state of Florida
>
>
> Dear Friends:
>
> Thank you for your letter to Governor Bush.  Governor Bush is sorry to
> learn
> of your concerns and asked me to respond on his behalf.
>
> The Florida Constitution limits the Governor's intervention in matters
> that
> should be resolved through the court system.  Each state attorney is an
> elected official charged with certain discretionary duties, including the
> duty to determine whether or not to prosecute any particular crime
> committed
> within his or her jurisdiction.  This decision is based on the quality and
> quantity of the evidence of guilt shown, and in the best interest of
> justice.  I encourage you to work with the state attorney's office and
> local
> law enforcement to resolve this situation.  If you have not already done
> so,
> you may also wish to obtain private legal counsel to assist you in this
> regard.   If you need assistance in locating an attorney, please call the
> Florida Bar's Referral Service at 1-800-342-8011.  For those unable to
> afford a lawyer, Florida Legal services or your local legal aid office has
> information about the availability of pro bono counsel.  The main
> telephone
> number for Florida Legal Services is 850-385-7900.
>
> I understand you are currently working with the Florida Department of Law
> Enforcement and the Florida Department of Business and Professional
> Regulation to resolve your concerns in this regard.  To further assist
> you,
> I am forwarding a copy of your e-mail to those agencies for their review
> and
> response.  I am confident someone from those Departments will contact you
> at
> their convenience.
>
> Thank you again for writing.  The Governor is sorry to learn of the
> problems
> you are facing and wishes he could be of more assistance.  Please know
> this
> is due to lack of jurisdiction, not lack of concern.
>
>
> Sincerely,
>
>
>
>
> Warren
> Davis
>
> Office

> Dear Special Agent Jacquelyn Bradway,
> RE: Fraud - Yvonnes Property Management:
> (jacquelynbradway@fdle.state.fl.us
> / 863 607 3808),
> It is encouraging that you are conducting an independent investigation
> into
> Yvonne's Property Management in terms of their criminal liability into
> this
> era of post-ENRON white collar crime.
> We, the undersigned, are working collectively to resolve this serious
> matter.
> We would like to support your investigation and would like you to clarify
> clarification of the following points:
> 1 When did your investigation start and What is the scope and terms of
> reference of your investigation?
>
> 2 How were complaints (to various bodies such as DACS/BBB/DBPR et al),
> over
> a long period of time, collectively heeded before Yvonnes decided to go
> out
> of business?
>
> 3 Have you spoken to all (existing/previous) customers of Yvonne's?
>
> 4 Have you spoken to Yvonne's staff ( Hutch/Howard Hutcheson, Will
> Montalvo,
> Miriam Cosme, Abby Caraballo, Lonka Carlos, Sherry Pursell, Kelly Jaspan,
> Patricia Lampinski, Tim Lutz, Ismael Santiago, Annett Gladden, Farancia
> Martin, Eric Allen, Neil Moore, Tim Kudlock etc ?)
>
> 5 Have you interviewed and investigated their sales representative Mike
> Sills regarding potential real estate fraud or other illegal activities?
>
> 6 How are you taking into account the information on www.top-forums.com ,
> mike.grogan@theledger.com and the whistle blowing incident as per
> http://www.theledger.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20060928/REPORTER/[REDACTED]/1068/YOURTOWN29
> etc
>
> 7 How many times has Yvonne's set up business and then filed for
> bankruptcy
> (or simply gone out of business) only to open up shop again and start
> fraudulent activity again (under same or different company name)?
>
> 8 How can Yvonne's bankruptcy be explained when their literature
> (attached)
> suggested they could sustain hurricanes AND another 911 - Do you see this
> as
> a gross violation of trade descriptions or not explicit fraud?
>
> 9 What legislation regulates setting up of a legitimate company and did
> Yvonne's comply (if yes, who validated their application and on what
> grounds)?
>
> 10 Has Yvonne's actually declared bankruptcy and what are the non-civil
> implications and otherwise?
>
> 11 How can we find out if they have sufficient assets before spending more
> dollars on a civil action (we have already suffered once and hope you do
> not
> make us suffer again)?
>
> 12 What has Yvonne's done with all the paperwork including personal
> details,
> bank information, termite certificates and licences?
>
> 13 If our personal information is used as part of identity fraud or
> phising
> what action are you able to take?
>
> 14 Why were keys left outside Yvonne's property (collected by CONTEMPO at
> Contempo Plaza, 43344 Hwy. 27. Davenport, FL 33837) - do you consider this
> action by Yvonnes as gross negligence beyond civil boundaries e.g. thieves
> could have just walked past, collected the keys (and god forbid) broken
> into
> ALL of our homes ?
>
> 15 Can it be explained why relatives/staff of Yvonne's stayed in client
> homes without approval - is this clear evidence that Yvonne's did not have
> any intention to paying owners right from the beginning?
>
> 16 Can it be explained why some homes, under Yvonne's control, were broken
> into items stolen and/or damaged - do you see this as gross violation of
> the
> human right of owners?
>
> 17 When will you be able to confirm if Yvonne's did (or did not) operate
> with deception and are worthy of being charged with fraudulent business
> activity leading to criminal proceedings - can you please explain how we
> can
> be engaged in this process?
>
> 18 What happens to Yvonne's funds if they are found to be criminally
> liable;
> e.g. do homeowners receive the money that was stolen from them?
> If found guilty, what penalty can Walter and Yvonne's expect and what can
> be
> done to stop Yvonne and Walter Bernstein from setting up another business
> and operating this scam again?
>
> 19 Can a lien be put against their assets and property until this matter
> is
> resolved and can an injection be gained to stop them escaping abroad with
> our money (unless they have already put our money in accounts outside the
> United States of America ?
>
> 20 Please find the attached documents used to invoke the scam including
> large payments for Google listing : can you specify other evidence you are
> (and are not) taking into account including the sheriffs engagement in
> cases
> of trespassing when owners legitimately requested their money?
>
> We would like to reinforce the fact that this inquiry has nothing to do
> with
> the contract we (property Owners) entered into but is specifically
> directed
> at the enticement , deception, theft and fraud (please see attachments)
> which was conducted by the Bernstein's through their management company:
> hopefully as a state regulator/law enforcement official you can do
> something
> about restoring justice as soon as possible.
>
> If nothing is done to stop this from happening again it would, in effect,
> make a mockery of the law and be appear indefensible and untenable for the
> State of Florida Legislature to condone.
>

> stage.

>

> informed of your actions.

Mr. Davis,
                Isn't the Tax Collectors office funded by the DMV? This would make it a state agency. It would be hard to ask the tax collector why he is spending tax payer money for a perfectly legal function, obviously he has his own personal reasons as to why he doesn't want a union to form. If State Government can't look into a matter then why do we have Government? That would be like police departments policing themselves, wrong doing would never be found .Again I am asking for someone other than the tax collector himself to look into the matter as to why he has spent 90 plus thousand dollars to keep a union from forming in Brevard County.

--- Governor Jeb Bush <jeb.bush@myflorida.com> wrote:

> For those E-Newsletter recipients who have Adobe
> Acrobat reader, Governor
> Bush's e-newsletter is available in .PDF format by
> clicking here:
> 
> http://www.flgov.com/in_the_news
> 
> The text version of the e-newsletter is below.
> 
> 
> TOWN OF EATONVILLE DESIGNATED AS FLORIDA'S 150TH
> "COMMUNITY FOR A LIFETIME"
> 
> Last week, I was joined by Department of Elder
> Affairs Interim Secretary
> Charles Corley in announcing the town of
> Eatonville's designation as
> Florida's 150th Community for a Lifetime.  The
> designation marks a milestone
> for the state: reaching our goal of 150
> participating communities by the end
> of 2006. With 23 percent of the state's population
> age 60 and older and a
> portion of the nation's 76 million baby boomers
> beginning to retire as soon
> as 2010, Communities for a Lifetime encourages
> communities to identify
> needed improvements that will meet the needs of
> seniors while benefiting all
> residents.  Participating communities use existing
> resources and technical
> assistance from the state to make crucial civic
> improvements in such areas
> as housing, health care, transportation,
> accessibility and recreation. The
> initiative's goal is to help Florida's communities
> become better places to
> live for all generations.  To learn more about the
> Communities for a
> Lifetime initiative or the Department of Elder
> Affairs, call (850) 414-2000
> or visit http://elderaffairs.state.fl.us.
> 
> 
> FLORIDA FAMILIES ENCOURAGED TO SHARE THE GIFT OF
> READING DURING THE HOLIDAYS
> 
> I encourage Florida families to share the gift of
> reading during the
> holidays by visiting the 2006 Just Read, Families!
> for the Holidays reading
> list. Research shows that students who read while on
> vacation risk sustain
> progress made throughout the school year.  Holiday
> and winter breaks are a
> great time for families to read together.  By
> encouraging students to read,
> we bolster the opportunities for them to succeed in
> their education and
> throughout life. The Just Read, Families! for the
> Holidays reading list can
> be found at: www.justreadfamilies.org.  The site
> features age-specific book
> suggestions.
> 
> 
> GOVERNOR BUSH LAUNCHES FOURTH ANNUAL "A SEASON OF
> READING" STATE AGENCY
> HOLIDAY BOOK DRIVE
> 
> On Monday, I launched the fourth annual "A Season of
> Reading" state agency
> book drive. A Season of Reading program collects and
> distributes new and
> gently used children's books to community programs,
> schools, family literacy
> programs and nonprofit agencies supporting
> children's reading activities.
> The deadline for book donations is January 19, 2007.
>  Last year, the holiday
> book drive involved 11 state agencies donating more
> than 80,000 books to
> Florida students and families.
> This year Florida's state agencies will participate
> in the holiday book
> drive by hosting drop-offs at locations throughout
> the state. For more
> information about "A Season of Reading" program or
> to get involved with
> providing books to children in your communities,
> please visit
> www.volunteerfloridafoundation.org. 
>

> to announce its annual
> holiday ornament, the fourth in a series. 
> Coinciding with its 50th
> anniversary and inclusion in the National Register
> of Historic Places, the
> image of the Governor's Mansion is appropriately
> featured on this year's
> ornament. The Foundation is also proud to announce
> the publication of First
> Families in Residence: Life at the Florida
> Governor's Mansion, by
> distinguished architectural historian Ellen J.
> Uguccioni. The new
> commemorative book is a lively chronicle of both the
> residence and the lives
> of the families, including interviews with many
> governors, first ladies and
> family members, as well as outstanding new and
> archival photographs never
> before published. To view and order both the new
> 2006 ornament (as well as

arrested for being a watch out for a murder.  Two were child mostlers and

they move away out of Florida.

>From: "Governor Jeb Bush" <Jeb.Bush@MyFlorida.com>
>To: "Edwina Pizzo-Irdem" <keycc2000@hotmail.com>
>Subject: RE: HELP ME
>Date: Wed, 20 Dec 2006 14:49:45 -0500
>
>Dear Edwina:
>
>Thank you for writing again to Governor Bush.  The Governor appreciates 
>your concerns and asked me to respond on his behalf.
>
>As you may know, the Florida Constitution limits the Governor's 
>intervention in matters that should be resolved through the court system.  
>If you are unhappy with a ruling or feel a case has not been handled 
>according to the law, you should speak with an attorney about what 
>appellate procedures may be available.  For those unable to afford a 
>lawyer, Florida Legal Services or the county legal aid association has 
>information about the availability of pro bono counsel.  The main telephone 
>number of Florida Legal Services is (850) 385-7900.  Those dissatisfied 
>with their representatives should consider choosing another attorney.
>
>Thank you again for writing.  The Governor is sorry to learn of the 
>problems you are facing and wishes he could be of more assistance.  Please 
>know this is due to lack of jurisdiction, not lack of concern.
>
>Sincerely,
>
>
>
>Warren Davis
>Office of Citizens' Services
>

From:	Janine Houghton <janine_houghton@msn.com>
Sent:	Tuesday, December 19, 2006 8:33 PM
To:	cldeaniii@aol.com; Governor Jeb Bush
Cc:	dustin-2871@msn.com
Subject:	RE: please help if you can

This was the original email that we sent to you in September but as to yet 
have had no response. I thought i would send a quick update.
Doug Hall of the Central Florida Visa Group has since been arrested by the 
Polk County Sheriff but released on bail, with a $30,000 bond. He has been 
charged with grand theft, forgery, uttering forged inst and unlawful use of 
notery commission. As yet we have recieved no payment of the money owed us 
and nor does it look like we will recieve any! I am now on maternity leave 
with 7 days before our baby is due and are now facing a double mortgage etc, 
Not a good situtaion to be in! We have just found out that the USA 
immigration London have turned our visa applictaion down despite being 
approved by the USA side?

>From: "Janine Houghton" <janine_houghton@msn.com>
>To: CC: dustin-2871@msn.com
>Subject: please help if you can
>Date: Thu, 21 Sep 2006 17:17:39 +0100
>
>Mr. & Mrs. Houghton
>5 Stour Close
>Stones Cross
>Pevensey
>East Sussex
>BN245QU
>ENGLAND
>21st September 2006
>
>
>Dear Mrs dean,
>
>We are a family from England who are in the process of trying to build a 
>business by investing everything we have. We thought America was the place 
>to do it.
>We were/are in the process of buying a scuba diving business in Naples 
>Florida.
>
>We as a family decided to follow our dream of taking our UK dive company to 
>Florida where we have been many times and have fallen in love with! The 
>idea was to bring tourists from the UK over to Naples, The keys and family 
>trips to Disney.
>We attended an immigration show in London, in March 2005 where we met Doug 
>Hall of The Central Florida Visa Group (CFVG) and Eric Allen of The Allen 
>Law Firm.
>We had a very lengthy conversation with Doug Hall and also with Eric Allen. 
>(Doug was the visa man, Eric the attorney and another man who was the 
>accountant).
>
>As you can imagine we had quite a few questions about the type of visa 
>needed and the prospect of buying a company or setting one up and also 
>moving our family abroad. Doug said that he would look after us and would 
>stay in contact with us and help us for the following year after moving out 
>etc. He said he was a firm believer of looking after families and that he 
>would only take half of his fees when engaging with him and the then the 
>other half when we were working in our new business to prove that he had 
>done his job. We registered our details and handed them into them.
>
>We then went on holiday again to Florida in October 05 to stay with friends 
>in Fort Myers, as this was the original area we wanted to live/work. We 
>went round many dive shops and then we found the shop of our dreams in 
>Naples. We spoke to the owners and they said they would be hoping to sell 
>in 6 months time.
>We went back to our friends and did some research on Doug Hall and Eric 
>Allen all seemed ok and professional.
>
>We then phoned Doug Hall to arrange a meeting with him before we flew home.
>We met Doug in his Davenport office. We explained everything about the 
>business; we showed him documents that we had got from the owners regarding 
>figures, contacts, income etc.
>
>
>
>
>He took all the details and photocopies of our passports. He said that he 
>would take a trip to Naples that week and would be contacting the owners to 
>do a due diligence report etc. He said by what he could see it looked an 
>excellent business opportunity and explained that the L1 visa would be the 
>best for us to apply for. He gave us forms to read through so that we were 
>aware of what was needed from us so that we could start the ball rolling 
>from our end. We flew home that afternoon.
>
>We arranged for Doug to forward a letter of engagement and the instructions 
>of wiring half his fees to him, which was $3000. The other $3000 was to be 
>forwarded after working for a month in our new business. We signed the 
>engagement letter and wired the money to him, he then proceeded with our 
>visa application.
>
>The plan was to take over the business for April 1st the start of the new 
>tax year.
>Doug submitted our visa application to the embassy and we re mortgaged our 
>house to raise the $215,000 needed to purchase the business. This was to be 
>wired to an Escrow account to be kept safe until the visa application had 
>been approved. Once approval had taken place the money would be transferred 
>to The Naples Dive Centre, or if our visa application was declined then it 
>would come back to us.
>
>The visa application submitted by Doug was of a low standard and we were 
>finding it increasingly more difficult in making contact with him. When we 
>did make contact he always had an excuse. We were not getting the 
>information and advice from Doug that we needed, the visa application was 
>declined so my husband flew out to the states to try to it sort out.
>
>He decided to meet up with Eric Allen as Doug said he had been helping with 
>the case. It was then that we discovered that they were totally separate 
>and Eric had not been dealing with our case at all and had no link with the 
>CFVG! Even though we had met them together on a stand and had paperwork 
>with both names on. Also the CFVG website had Eric Allens name on.
>
>Eric Allen said that he only rented an office to Doug Hall. We then 
>discovered I was 6 weeks pregnant. All were informed, as we were concerned 
>whether it would alter the visa application. We were informed by the Allen 
>Law Firm that this would be ok as if I had the baby in Naples it would be a 
>USA citizen, if we were not in the states by then they would then look 
>into. Eric Allen agreed to help us with our visa application and helped us 
>submit a good application (which should have happened first time!) and we 
>were approved by the US Embassy. We now wait to hear from the US Embassy 
>London to hear whether we will get our visas issued. We spent the day at 
>the London Embassy. 7 hours in all waiting to be called for interview! We 
>were then told it would take a week for them to read through our paperwork 
>and then we would hear. Its now been five weeks!  We still have not heard 
>from them. Do you know why it is taking so long?
>Nothing is going smoothly for us we constantly seem to run into problems or 
>hold ups.
>
>
>Due to Dougs failed visa application, we then decided that we wanted Eric 
>Allen to look after our money being held in the Escrow account.
>We informed Doug of our wishes he kept on stalling us; we were then 
>becoming increasingly concerned. Eventually he informed us that he needed 
>an original signed letter of termination from us giving him permission to 
>forward the funds to the Allen Law Firm. This we did straight away by 
>signed for mail. The transfer still didnt take place, a few of his excuses 
>were out of town, didnt make the bank in time, its now the weekend 
>cannot do until Monday etc. He then promised a date that the transfer would 
>happen. We informed Eric Allen of the date. By this time my pregnancy is 
>progressing, our daughter had finished her year at school and had said her 
>emotional goodbyes to her friends and teachers. Not easy for a 12 year old 
>girl!
>
>As you can imagine the transfer never took place, numerous phone messages 
>and emails were sent to Doug. We contacted Eric Allen who had not heard 
>from him either. We then sent Doug an email saying if the funds were not 
>transferred we would be contacting the police etc. He then sent us an email 
>admitting that he did not have the money! Imaging our horror and disbelieve 
>after all this time. By now you can imaging my hormones are not making it 
>easy for me! I just about lost it! My poor husband, not only had he the 
>fact our money had gone he also had to deal with a blubbering wreck!
>
>As you can see Doug promised that he was going to sell a property to help 
>cover the funds, the date of this happening kept changing, Naples dive also 
>wrote to him, saying that the money had to go through by the 18th August. 
>Well after more excuses with being out of town, phone not working, and 
>house sell a week later, etc. He then said that if we informed the 
>authorities it would take months for us to receive our money and could 
>affect the house sell etc.
>
>We received an email from a friend of Naples Dive Shop who informed us that 
>Doug was a con man etc; he was just using delay tactics and the only chance 
>of getting our money back was to actually go to Florida again and get it! 
>So my husband booked a flight leaving the Sunday, flying home the 
>Wednesday. He phoned Doug informing him of this and arranged to meet him At 
>Bartow bank, Doug said that he didnt have all of the money but had 
>$170,000. Doug said that he would meet Dustin in Mac Donalds at 10.00am. 
>The owners of Naples Dive Centre also came to meet him. Doug met them and 
>agreed to sign over some of his assets, a Rolex watch, a Harley Davidson 
>and a BMW car. No money was transferred and Doug arranged to meet Dustin 
>later on that afternoon with a written note of signing over his assets. He 
>arranged to meet Dustin on the Tuesday with the money, which had now gone 
>down to $140,000. He didnt make the Tuesday! Dustin went to see a lawyer 
>(more expense!) Who agreed to take on our case.
>
>The lawyer came with Dustin to meet Doug on the Wednesday much to the 
>surprise of Doug. Doug then admitted he did not have the money. So my 
>husband came home and we have now left it in the hands of our lawyer.
>We have also just found out that the Dive Centre that we were buying is now 
>giving us 60 days to pay or they will sell to someone else!
>We have re mortgaged our house and could end up homeless! We could have our 
>home reprocessed while Doug we hear has quite a few in Florida and other 
>countries and there is no risk that he can loose his! The extra money we 
>had to help us with having a baby is now being used to pay for a lawyer. If 
>we do manage to obtain our money Its probably too late for me to be able 
>to fly as I am now 28 weeks pregnant so I will be left in the UK all 
>because of a greedy con man who cares about no one but himself, who still 
>advertises on the web for more unsuspecting people who are trying to better 
>themselves and make a better life for themselves and their family. Our 
>American dream has become more of a nightmare!
>
>Im about to leave my job to start maternity leave and my husband is to 
>leave his soon. So soon we will be jobless and homeless!
>I am writing to you as a plea from a mother and of a wife in the hope that 
>you may know of any way we can get our money back? And also to prevent this 
>from happening to any other family. It has totally destroyed our family and 
>at a time when we should be happy and enjoying life! My husband is totally 
>devastated and is not sleeping and fears for us as a family (He is a broken 
>man). Now all of our hard work and savings have all gone to a con man. We 
>are hoping that you can restore our faith in Americans. We are professional 
>people who with qualifications who were hoping to add to the American 
>economy.
>We dont know how any American can treat a British alli the way Doug Hall 
>has and is continuing to do so!
>
>Is there anyone else you can recommend us contacting? Or anything else we 
>can do?
>The Polk County Police are also investigating this but we fear he may be 
>trying to flee the country. Or that he has signed his assets over to 
>relatives etc.
>Please help us as we fear time is running out!
>
>Thank you for taking the time to read this email and sorry for being so 
>long, we look forward to hearing from you.
>
>
>Please help! We are becoming desperate
>
>
>
>Dustin, Janine and Jemma Houghton.
>

To Whom It May Concern;

 

I am in dire need of help Ive been litigating with my sister over an argument that escalated and dragged into the judicial system.  In a vindictive manner the mother was taken to court and a Judge granted the Aunt due to a physiological bond between Nephew and Aunt the Aunt was granted visitation.  The aunt provided childcare for the mother then refused and chosen to drag me into the court system.  I Cristina Lugones the mother have NEVER been found unfit; on the contrary I am a professional individual who is raising two children on my own.   Ive been investigated poked and probed.   The story is very in-depth and covers many issues that have not been addressed due to the unjust behavior of the attorneys involved and/or the Judge.  Ive been paying for an attorney here in Florida and the courts here have not yet taken jurisdiction.  I find it inconceivable that a Judge would grant this type of rights to an Aunt even after nothing was found for me to be judged.  Of course an Aunt and Nephew have a bond that is NOT enough to be granted any rights in the courts.  That indirectly means that a childcare provider can in fact receive standing to get visitation /partial custody of a child against a mother whether or not if there sisters.

I really need help in finding out my rights with my son.  After spending approximately $10,000.00 in the past year and a half now my funds have been depleted and I am unable to afford any attorney which is now hindering my from providing from my children.

Please contact me to assist me in knowing my rights.

 

If not I need a MIRACLE!

Cristina Lugones

Cell (954) 889-4644

Office (954) 453-8337

Hollywood, FL 33020

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

From:	pms06@netzero.com
Sent:	Sunday, December 17, 2006 8:30 AM
To:	Governor Jeb Bush
Subject:	Angel Nieves Diaz

Dear Governor Bush:

Please let me start by saying that as a Governor, you have done a tremendous job for Florida, I wish we could have you another term, but Charlie Crist is OK as well.

Regarding the execution of Angel Nieves Diaz; to bad, so sad, etc..

He did not care about cruel and unusual punishment when he murdered that Miami topless bar manager 27 years ago. Does he think that the constitution applies to him now ? He (his family/ and or representatives for his  family), they did not  think about his victim's constitutional rights.

It saddens and sickens me that we have taken SO long to execute him.  I understand that appeals process must be carried out, but why? Why do we allow Death Row inmates to live, breath and be a burden on the great State of Florida for decades? Back in the day when you were found guilty by a death sentence crime you were hung in the town square within 30 days. That is long enough to get your affairs in order. Most don't have affairs to get in order, but in the event that they did, 30 days is more than enough time to accomplish this. After all, they did not give their victims time to get there affairs in order.

I know that you have suspended executions for a Commission Study, and I have to say I am most displeased. Our prisons are filled with criminals who don't want or care what is happening, they just want to waste the courts time and be given the rights under the constitution. Again, I disagree. Occasionally there is an innocent man in prison, but that is a rarity, not the rule. Yes technology can be wonderful, but if a jury of their peers sends them to prison, then something had to make them make that decision.

The trial, the verdict, death. So simple, and although he may have suffered, again, too bad!!!

I ask, what about the family of this man he murdered? Their husband, friend, lover, brother, son, father, uncle etc., was cruelly taken from them, gunned down and his murderer has been convicted. 27 years and he finally dies. So he dies a painful death, I am sure the death of his victim was painful also.

Why don't we truly start with sever punishment, arrested, verdict, death. No more screwing around because he has rights. Does he not forfeit his civil rights once he becomes a convicted felon? I have no sense of obligation or responsibility to find out what happened, IF a mistake was made, so be it. We are not all free from mistakes.

I wish just for once that we would truly get tough on crime, and start acting as they did in the old days. Hang em high, sell t-shirts, make some money for the state, and move on. Cut down on the millions of dollars spent to keep them alive. Clean off death row, and you have a a serious crime deterrent.

Paula M Strickland

Dear Friend:

Thank you for your e-mail to Governor Bush.  The Governor asked me to 
respond on his behalf.

Although the Governor appreciates the opportunity to review your concerns, 
this is a local government matter.  As you may know, our government is 
structured on the notion that local communities can best assess the needs of 
their residents.  You would do well to continue to work with your locally 
elected sheriff and state attorney's offices to resolve your concerns in 
this regard.

Of course, should you suspect a child is in any danger, notify your local 
law enforcement or the Department of Children and Families' hot line, 
1-800-96-ABUSE.

If Governor Bush can help you with a concern in the area of state 
government, please let him know.

                                                                        Sincerely,



                                                                        Warren 
Davis
                                                                        Office 
of Citizens' Services


I am so elated to see there is a place for a man to vent his frustrations 
concerning the act of being the victim of a domestic violence relationship.I 
was intended to marry a woman who had three children(triplets) of her own I 
had no children. We dated for approx. 5 years and I never could commit 
because her actions  continually  worsened after the first year.There were 
arguments about everything ,regardles if there were any problems. I soon 
found out ,in her mind there were always problems and therefore something to 
argue or critize me about.I will tell one story giving her reaction to give 
a general idea of her thinking,but there were many.On a business trip 
approximately three hours from home I approached the scene of a tragic 
traffic accident that had just seconds before happened. No one else would be 
present for approx.ten to fifteen minutes.Two young ladies from Texas were 
on there way to a rehersal dinner for a collage friend in Florida when they 
mistakenly passed a vehicle at the wrong time ,colliding head on with a 
gentleman in a pick-up truck Both vehicles were estimated to have been going 
70+ miles per hour .I immediately ran to the ladys car first.The driver was 
tangled in a mass of steel with one arm severed from what I could see at the 
time. I tore off a piece of a shirt and tied off the arteries. The car then 
started on fire. I rushed over to the truck and found a fire extinquisher in 
the back. I then put out the fire, but ther was just barely enough chemicals 
.If the fire had re-started there was nothing I coul have done. I then 
proceeded to remove the passenger from the car due to the possibility of the 
fire.I could not remove her from the car as she was pinned under the dash 
and the door was jammed. The driver was finally removed from the car when 
paramedics arrived and she was severed below the waist.There is a lot more 
incidents that occured,but I will get back to the purpose of telling the 
story.This was actually quite tramatic to me and even I am amased at how 
calmley I reacted.When I returned home to my spouse to be and told her of 
the story I was devistated by her response.She stated"See,that is how 
thoughtless you are.You don't stop to think about me or my children.What if 
one of those women would have had aids and you bring that home to me and my 
kids." I was speachless. Things worsened over the next year or so until I 
decided I had to get out.,but I was still curious as to why she acted with 
such unusual behavior.In my search for answers Iwent to a computer that was 
given to her by her "surrogate mother".It had burnt up about a year prior 
but when I contacted the computer tech he still had the system.I asked if he 
could reove the hard-drive ,out it in another system and see if there was 
anything that could help me to understand my situation. When he inserted the 
hard-drive he found most of what had been there was deleted. He then 
undeleted the hard-drive to find,at my amasement again,30,000 pictures of 
pornography.Everything you could possibly imagine from children to 
beasteality and everything in between.This woman is 62 years old,and lives 
alone with her husband of about same age ,except for every other weekend 
they keep the three children belonging to  what was to be my wife.I took 
this information to the mother of the children and that is where my 
nightmare began with her,the judicial system and the law. As soon as I told 
her of this woman having the pornography she went out and filed a domestic 
violence order against me.Since the filing she has managed to have me 
arrested twice,spend over$ 80,000 in attorney fees for ,what in actuality 
was her stalking me.When I was in the court ,facing these issues and at the 
same time trying to convince the Judge (by me I mean my counsel) what was 
really happening,including me having at the hearing witnesses that could 
verify everything Iwas saying and heard from her own mouth a different story 
than what she told the judge,the judge refused to let ANY of my witnesses 
speak.All of my witnesses were very respected people,I.E.,a 30 year state 
prosecutor,A captain on the police dept,a probation officer for the 
state,ect.,all of which knew the truth about this woman and were to testify 
on my behalf. The judge looks at the woman and asks"are you afraid for your 
life" to which she applies "yes" and he concluded the hearing,not allowing 
anyone to speak on my behalf.I feel by the existence of the porn and other 
things I have seen in the older couples residence ,the children are most 
likely being sodomized and the mother is aware of it.When I went to the 
police dept with the information ,they would do nothing stating there was a 
problem due to  "chain of command".I then understand by my own 
counsel,should I try and pursue the authorities with this information of 
pornography and very possible child abuse,that I would likely be charged by 
the judge, who issued the order,with a contempt charge of 
harrasement.Unbeleivable system...Sadly neglected children. To anyone 
reading this is there any recourse through a higher power than the court to 
get free from this woman and  help the children,although I have been told 
they are not my problem.I can't help but feel for them They are 9 years 
old.2boys and a girl.         jwconti@cox.net

From:	ariel <ariel@spoomusic.com>

Mr. Davis,

Thank you for your response. I just wanted to get my viewpoint across to 
you and Jeb regarding the death penalty. It just seems somewhat 
backwards and unenlightened to kill someone for a crime that they 
committed. I understand that families want retribution, I understand 
this all too well. But, to take a human life in response to the taking 
of a human life just doesn't make sense to me.

I should remark that I am infinitely impressed with your fair treatment 
of those who are accused of a crime. I am also incredibly impressed with 
your technological prowess concerning DNA testing and criminology.

I do see hypocrisy in certain people that endorse a death penalty, 
particularly in those that are pro-life. How can they say that a woman 
doesn't have a right to an abortion and yet it is alright to take a 
human life if that human is convicted of a heinous crime? But, I digress.

Thank you for listening to what I have to say and for taking my concern 
to heart. In conclusion, I would like to state again that I believe that 
the death penalty is a free ticket out of responsibility and that 
criminals that commit atrocities such as rape, child molestation and 
murder should be forced to live their days out in prison and doing 
community service.

Sincerely,
Ariel

Governor Jeb Bush wrote:
> Dear Ariel:
>
> Florida Governor Jeb Bush thanks you for your letter inquiring about his views regarding the death penalty.   
>
> While the Governor appreciates that many people have sincere and devout beliefs that capital punishment should be abolished, he does not believe such a policy would promote justice or save innocent lives.  In heinous murder cases in which a jury and judge have determined the convicted murderer deserves the ultimate punishment, Governor Bush believes, based on state law, the sentence should be carried out unless mitigating circumstances justify further consideration.  The Governor also believes we should look not only to the issues surrounding the defendant, but also to the surviving victims and to the effect the murder has on our community as a whole when deciding whether the death penalty is an appropriate punishment.
>
> Florida law provides strict limitations on the use of capital punishment.  A person accused of a capital crime is provided free legal representation if he or she is unable to afford a lawyer.  Unlike other states, Florida law requires the prosecutor to share evidence with the accused murderer's lawyer.  The accused is allowed access to DNA testing and other evidence that might demonstrate innocence.  Once a person is convicted of a capital murder, the death penalty may only be imposed if aggravating factors are proven to exist.  Thus, only first-degree murders that involve unspeakable cruelty and suffering, multiple victims, a motivation for financial gain, a desire to eliminate a witness, and other exceptionally brutal facts qualify for capital punishment. 
>
> Florida law also provides numerous levels of appeals for the convicted individual before the sentence is moved.  Once a person is convicted of an aggravated first-degree murder and sentenced to death in Florida, the state voluntarily provides free legal representation to the convicted murderer until the sentence is carried out or reduced on appeal.  Florida has provided more than $59 million in post-conviction legal representation to persons sentenced to death. No other state has invested the public resources in capital post conviction legal representation that Florida has been providing for well over a decade. 
>
> Governor Bush shares the concerns of many that the death penalty must be reserved for only the most heinous cases.  As the Governor has said many times, the signing of a death warrant is one of the most solemn and somber responsibilities he must undertake, and he does so with humble deliberation.
>
> Again, thank you for taking the time to write about this very serious issue.
>
> Sincerely,
>
> Warren Davis
> Office of Citizens' Services
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: ariel [mailto:ariel@spoomusic.com]
> Sent: Thursday, December 14, 2006 12:18 PM
> To: Governor Jeb Bush
> Subject: anti death penalty
>
>
> Dear Jeb,
>
> I am writing in hopes that one day you might change your view on the 
> death sentence. Do you not believe that it is more torturous to keep a 
> man alive in prison for the rest of his life than to set him free into 
> the great unknown of death? Is the price not heavier to know that your 
> life is wasted in a cell than to be granted a freedom of sorts into 
> death? When I hear of a heinous convict being executed, it just fills my 
> heart with sadness that this heinous convict is essentially being let 
> free. Not only that, but would Christ put a man to death?
>
> This is a simple plea to your common sense. I'm hoping that one day you 
> will be an advocate against the death penalty. It is wrong, it is 
> unjust, not only because it is fighting death with death, but also 
> because it is a speedy send-off to a place that we know very little 
> about: the afterlife. A murderer or child molester should never be 
> allowed 'off the hook' via the death sentence. They should remain alive, 
> in prison, for the entirety of their lives, until they are old and gray. 
> Their freedoms should be removed for their entire life and the bonds of 
> life should not be removed unnaturally.

Very honoured governor Bush, 
 
today we in Germany get to know in the morning news from the gruesome execution of the capital punishment in a prisoner at the last night. We hear that the prisoner has passed away only after 34 agonising minutes after putting of the death syringe. Germans are horrified about this "modern" however still medieval execution method of the capital punishment. This practise throws a very bad light on your land and especially your state in which many Europeans are living.
 
Here it is not about the guilt which the convicted has loaded by his action on himself. It should be judged in no way slightly. No, it is about the method with which one of the most modern states of the world - the leadership nation of the free world - "carries" a citizen of your land in this "On the other side". This is unbelievable, stupefying, medieval. One feels reminded in the time of the inquisition of old Rome. We do not have the right to interfere in the internal problems of your policy. It is very macabre! In hope that changes in this point something I wish you and your family blest Christmas. Hopefully you have it after this event. How you can go after this guilt to a church and pray there for the world, is incomprehensible to me.
 
Quiet and deferential greetings from Germany.

-----Original Message-----
From: Governor Jeb Bush [mailto:Jeb.Bush@MyFlorida.com] 
Sent: Thursday, December 14, 2006 10:26 AM
To: Lugones, Cristina (MAN-Lauderdale)
Subject: RE: ** need help please I've exhausted every effort***Childcare
Provider (big sister) vs. Mother (little sister)

Dear Ms. Lugones:

Thank you for your recent e-mail to Governor Bush requesting assistance
with a child custody matter.  He has asked me to respond.
 
Custody and visitation rulings are under the jurisdiction of the
judicial system.  Under Florida law, the court's decision in these cases
is based on the best interest of the child or children involved.  Judges
review all of the information presented to them and apply the law to
make their decision.
 
The Florida Constitution limits the Governor's intervention in matters
that should be resolved through the court system.  If you are unhappy
with a ruling or feel a case has not been handled according to the law,
you should speak with an attorney about what appellate procedures may be
available.  For those unable to afford a lawyer, Florida Legal Services
or the county legal aid association has information about the
availability of pro bono counsel.  The main telephone number of Florida
Legal Services is (850) 385-7900.  Those dissatisfied with their
representatives should consider choosing another attorney.
 
Thank you again for writing.  The Governor is sorry to learn of the
problems you are facing and wishes he could be of more assistance.
Please know this is due to lack of jurisdiction, not lack of concern.
 
Sincerely,
 
 
 
Warren Davis
Office of Citizens' Services

From:	Vtor Neves <vneves@ua.pt>

Subject:	Execution of Angel Nieves Diaz

Importance:	High

Dear Governor,
 
The following is an adaptation of a message I prepared, but unfortunately was not sent timely.
 
As I actually I do not know what if the execution is still pending and  I am convinced that  the main arguments presented are valid whatever the outcome might have been, i take the opportunity to present them. 
 
Angel Nieves Diaz was scheduled for execution on last December 13th for the assassination of Joseph Nagy in 1979, and I am hereby expressing my wishes  that death penalty was not applied.
 
Justice must be given to the family of Joseph Nagy: the assassinaion of a beloved one can never be adequately compensated.
 
But I feel that Justice is not necessarily served by applying the death penalty, the more so when actual doubts subsist about a trial proceedings and jury decisions. It is now common knowledge that Justice is often not as blind as one wishes, and that  a significant number of capital punishments have even been applied to innocent individuals.
 
In Angel Nieves Diaz case, ambiguous medical psychiatric evaluations in face of incoherent behaviour of the accused, his limited knowledge of english and clearly declared ignorance of basic legal means and procedures, imply his incompetence to represent himself in court.
 
Also weak, even contradictory  testimonies --- indeed actual lack of faithful testimonies in this case --- were reason enough for  the National Committee on Capital Punishement to defend, in 2002, the suspension of death penalties, especially  in situations such as Angel Nieves Diaz'.  
 
As common place as the sentence might be, a jury is composed of human beings, and having to judge a person of foreign descent  who defends him or herself feet and hand cuffed is prone to manifestations of insecurity which,  again in Angel Nieves Diaz case reveal themselves in far from unanimous decisions. 
 
I love the United States of America for many reasons. I often find myself defending the quality of its system of Justice and stating what I think are  reasons for it to be as it is. It pains me when I deeply feel that Justice might not have been served.
 
Dear Governor, if still possible, please stop this one more execution.
 
Yours Sicerely 
 
Vtor Neves

From: "Governor Jeb Bush" <Jeb.Bush@MyFlorida.com>
To: "jwconti" <jwconti@cox.net>
Sent: Thursday, December 14, 2006 9:57 AM
Subject: RE: Copy to


Dear Friend:

Thank you for your e-mail to Governor Bush.  The Governor asked me to 
respond on his behalf.

Although the Governor appreciates the opportunity to review your concerns, 
this is a local government matter.  As you may know, our government is 
structured on the notion that local communities can best assess the needs of 
their residents.  You would do well to continue to work with your locally 
elected sheriff and state attorney's offices to resolve your concerns in 
this regard.

Of course, should you suspect a child is in any danger, notify your local 
law enforcement or the Department of Children and Families' hot line, 
1-800-96-ABUSE.

If Governor Bush can help you with a concern in the area of state 
government, please let him know.

                                                                        Sincerely,



                                                                        Warren 
Davis
                                                                        Office 
of Citizens' Services

concerning the act of being the victim of a domestic violence relationship.I

arguments about everything ,regardles if there were any problems. I soon 
found out ,in her mind there were always problems and therefore something to 
argue or critize me about.I will tell one story giving her reaction to give

approximately three hours from home I approached the scene of a tragic 
traffic accident that had just seconds before happened. No one else would be 
present for approx.ten to fifteen minutes.Two young ladies from Texas were 
on there way to a rehersal dinner for a collage friend in Florida when they 
mistakenly passed a vehicle at the wrong time ,colliding head on with a 
gentleman in a pick-up truck Both vehicles were estimated to have been going 
70+ miles per hour .I immediately ran to the ladys car first.The driver was 
tangled in a mass of steel with one arm severed from what I could see at the 
time. I tore off a piece of a shirt and tied off the arteries. The car then 
started on fire. I rushed over to the truck and found a fire extinquisher in 
the back. I then put out the fire, but ther was just barely enough chemicals 
.If the fire had re-started there was nothing I coul have done. I then 
proceeded to remove the passenger from the car due to the possibility of the 
fire.I could not remove her from the car as she was pinned under the dash 
and the door was jammed. The driver was finally removed from the car when 
paramedics arrived and she was severed below the waist.There is a lot more 
incidents that occured,but I will get back to the purpose of telling the 
story.This was actually quite tramatic to me and even I am amased at how 
calmley I reacted.When I returned home to my spouse to be and told her of 
the story I was devistated by her response.She stated"See,that is how 
thoughtless you are.You don't stop to think about me or my children.What if 
one of those women would have had aids and you bring that home to me and my 
kids." I was speachless. Things worsened over the next year or so until I 
decided I had to get out.,but I was still curious as to why she acted with 
such unusual behavior.In my search for answers Iwent to a computer that was 
given to her by her "surrogate mother".It had burnt up about a year prior 
but when I contacted the computer tech he still had the system.I asked if he 
could reove the hard-drive ,out it in another system and see if there was 
anything that could help me to understand my situation. When he inserted the 
hard-drive he found most of what had been there was deleted. He then 
undeleted the hard-drive to find,at my amasement again,30,000 pictures of 
pornography.Everything you could possibly imagine from children to 
beasteality and everything in between.This woman is 62 years old,and lives 
alone with her husband of about same age ,except for every other weekend 
they keep the three children belonging to  what was to be my wife.I took 
this information to the mother of the children and that is where my 
nightmare began with her,the judicial system and the law. As soon as I told 
her of this woman having the pornography she went out and filed a domestic 
violence order against me.Since the filing she has managed to have me 
arrested twice,spend over$ 80,000 in attorney fees for ,what in actuality 
was her stalking me.When I was in the court ,facing these issues and at the 
same time trying to convince the Judge (by me I mean my counsel) what was 
really happening,including me having at the hearing witnesses that could 
verify everything Iwas saying and heard from her own mouth a different story 
than what she told the judge,the judge refused to let ANY of my witnesses 
speak.All of my witnesses were very respected people,I.E.,a 30 year state 
prosecutor,A captain on the police dept,a probation officer for the 
state,ect.,all of which knew the truth about this woman and were to testify 
on my behalf. The judge looks at the woman and asks"are you afraid for your 
life" to which she applies "yes" and he concluded the hearing,not allowing 
anyone to speak on my behalf.I feel by the existence of the porn and other 
things I have seen in the older couples residence ,the children are most 
likely being sodomized and the mother is aware of it.When I went to the 
police dept with the information ,they would do nothing stating there was a 
problem due to  "chain of command".I then understand by my own 
counsel,should I try and pursue the authorities with this information of 
pornography and very possible child abuse,that I would likely be charged by 
the judge, who issued the order,with a contempt charge of 
harrasement.Unbeleivable system...Sadly neglected children. To anyone 
reading this is there any recourse through a higher power than the court to 
get free from this woman and  help the children,although I have been told 
they are not my problem.I can't help but feel for them They are 9 years 
old.2boys and a girl.         jwconti@cox.net

-----Original Message-----
From: Governor Jeb Bush [mailto:Jeb.Bush@MyFlorida.com] 
Sent: Friday, December 08, 2006 10:54 AM
To: Dumorange@bellsouth.net
Subject: 

Dear Mr. Dumorange:

Thank you for sharing your concerns with Governor Bush and Lieutenant
Governor toni Jennings about your legal situation.  The Governor is sorry to
learn of your difficulty, and has asked me to respond.

The Florida Constitution limits the Governor's intervention in matters that
should be resolved through the court system.  The person who can best answer
your legal questions is an attorney.  If you need assistance in locating an
attorney, please call the Florida Bar's Referral Service at 1-800-342-8011.
For those unable to afford a lawyer, Florida Legal Services or your local
legal aid office has information about the availability of pro bono counsel.
The main telephone number for Florida Legal Services is 850-385-7900.

For further assistance, you may wish to contact the Criminal Justice
Professionalism Program, Florida Department of Law Enforcement.  The address
is Post Office Box 1489, Tallahassee, Florida 32202, and the telephone
number is (850) 410-8600.  This office establishes administrative procedures
for denial, suspension, or revocation of law enforcement officer
certification if a violation of Florida Administrative Code 11B27.0011 is
proven.  To further assist you, I am forwarding a copy of this letter to the
Florida Department of Law Enforcement.  I encourage you to contact that
agency to share your concerns at your earliest convenience.

Those who believe law enforcement officers may be guilty of criminal
misconduct should bring their evidence to the local state attorney.  The
state attorney makes the decision to prosecute anyone who may be guilty of a
crime.  You can obtain the name of the state attorney in your circuit by
calling directory assistance.  

Thank you again for writing.  The Governor is sorry to learn of the problems
you are facing and wishes he could be of more assistance.  

						Sincerely,



						Warren Davis
						Office of Citizens' Services
